metadata.Title: CVE-2020-25623 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Erlang/OTP 22.3.x before 22.3.4.6 and 23.x before 23.1 allows Directory Traversal. An attacker can send a crafted HTTP request to read arbitrary files, if httpd in the inets application is used.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-25623` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

erlang - 1:20.2.2+dfsg-1ubuntu2
erlang-asn1 - 1:20.2.2+dfsg-1ubuntu2
erlang-base - 1:20.2.2+dfsg-1ubuntu2
erlang-base-hipe - 1:20.2.2+dfsg-1ubuntu2
erlang-common-test - 1:20.2.2+dfsg-1ubuntu2

No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> per upstream, introduced in OTP 22.3.1 and corrected in OTP 22.3.4.6. It was also introduced in OTP 23.0 and corrected in OTP 23.1

criterions.comment: erlang package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:20.2.2+dfsg-1ubuntu2').
